pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:0.5: 69. The training rule on following preceptors
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:1.2: At that time nuns who had received the full ordination did not follow their preceptor for two years.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:1.4: and they did not know what was allowable and what was not.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:1.5: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:1.6: “How can those nuns receive the full ordination and then not follow their preceptor for two years?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:1.7: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:1.10: “… How can nuns receive the full ordination and then not follow their preceptor for two years?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:1.11: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:1.12: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:1.13: ‘If a nun does not follow the preceptor who gave her the full ordination for two years, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:2.1.5: Who gave her the full ordination:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:2.1.6: who gave her the full ordination.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:2.1.12: does not herself attend on her.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:2.1.13: If she thinks, “I won’t follow her for two years,” then by the mere fact of giving up the duty, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:2.2.2: if the preceptor is ignorant or shameless;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:2.2.6: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:2.2.7: The ninth training rule is finished.
